description: {"blocks":[{"key":"36rd0","text":"This document provides a guide to the protocols used by the Marine Biological Association for DNA extraction and barcoding of marine metazoans sampled for the Darwin Tree of Life project. The selection of organisms described are due to these species requiring more optimized techniques than the high-throughput method otherwise used by the Natural History Museum (dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.8epv5x7qjg1b/v1). Please note that this is a working document, with more organism-specific barcoding methods being added as they become optimized. The methods described are generally successful for the selected groups, but may still require further optimization for some samples. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":364,"length":48}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ccnc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"0D15A53C849311EE97E90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.8epv5x7qjg1b/v1"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

{"blocks":[{"key":"3jtvq","text":"References: Adapted from Figueroa et al, 2020 and Rossel et al., 2023","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4u6g","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0ib4","text":"Figueroa, N.J., Figueroa, D.F. and Hicks, D., 2020. Phylogeography of Acartia tonsa Dana, 1849 (Calanoida: Copepoda) and phylogenetic reconstruction of the genus Acartia Dana, 1846. Marine Biodiversity, 50, pp.1-20.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":182,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":203,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80g12","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cv6kl","text":"Rossel, S., Kaiser, P., Bode‐Dalby, M., Renz, J., Laakmann, S., Auel, H., Hagen, W., Arbizu, P.M. and Peters, J., 2023. Proteomic fingerprinting enables quantitative biodiversity assessments of species and ontogenetic stages in Calanus congeners (Copepoda, Crustacea) from the Arctic Ocean. Molecular Ecology Resources, 23(2), pp.382-395.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":291,"length":27},{"style":"italic","offset":320,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"36c0u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"737q7","text":"DNA extraction: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"643d5","text":"Samples were incubated in 30 μl chelex (InstaGene Matrix, Bio-Rad) for 50 min at 56°C, followed by a denaturation of the enzymes for 10 min at 96°C. Centrifuge samples @10,000rpm for 1min and carefully pipette out supernatant (avoid Chelex beads!). The resulting sample was used directly as DNA template for PCR amplification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"32fn1","text":"Sample concentrations varied between 1-50ng/ul. {"blocks":[{"key":"edpr8","text":"DNA extraction: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d820b","text":"Unless otherwise stated, DNA extraction for marine metazoans is done with the Qiagen DNAeasy Mouse Blood and Tissue kit. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8iqg6","text":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/Resources/ResourceDetail?id=aa250d94-fc4b-4e27-bb74-d32391ff8a48\u0026lang=en","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":98}],"data":{}},{"key":"fsj9u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dm74l","text":"The provided protocol is followed, apart from the final elution step: ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5dadc","text":"Pre-heated elution buffer (56C) is used to increase yield. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"qru8","text":"An elution volume of 60ul is used to increase the final DNA concentration. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8fj8k","text":"The buffer is left to incubate on the membrane for 5 minutes. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fgfqi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"btjam","text":"If sample yields are relatively high (\u003e25ng/ul), gDNA samples are usually diluted by 1:10 to reduce contamination during PCR amplification. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7a0c2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"484523DE849411EE97E90A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.qiagen.com/us/Resources/ResourceDetail?id=aa250d94-fc4b-4e27-bb74-d32391ff8a48\u0026lang=en"}}}}
